publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5762 Jackie Baillie: New Chapter for Vale of Leven Academy—That the Parliament congratulates the Vale of Leven Academy on the official opening of its new school on 9 November 2009; welcomes the fact that old boy and former Bishop of Edinburgh, the Rev Richard Holloway, performed the opening ceremony; notes that 2009 was the 100th anniversary of the school’s name; recognises that the new Vale of Leven Academy has modern classrooms with interactive technology and the very latest sports facilities; further notes that the new school was commissioned by the previous Labour administration in West Dunbartonshire Council with funding allocated by the former Labour-led Scottish Executive, and looks forward to many generations to come being educated in a new, modern, 21st century school.

S3M-5762 Jackie Baillie: New Chapter for Vale of Leven Academy—That the Parliament congratulates the Vale of Leven Academy on the official opening of its new school on 9 November 2009; welcomes the fact that old boy and former Bishop of Edinburgh, the Rev Richard Holloway, performed the opening ceremony; notes that 2009 was the 100th anniversary of the school’s name; recognises that the new Vale of Leven Academy has modern classrooms with interactive technology and the very latest sports facilities; further notes that the new school was commissioned by the previous Labour administration in West Dunbartonshire Council with funding allocated by the former Labour-led Scottish Executive, and looks forward to many generations to come being educated in a new, modern, 21st century school. Supported by: Des McNulty*
S3M-5762 New Chapter for Vale of Leven Academy (lodged on 11 February 2010) Karen Whitefield*, Mary Mulligan*, Pauline McNeill*, James Kelly*, Mr Frank McAveety*
S3M-5762 New Chapter for Vale of Leven Academy (lodged on 11 February 2010) Trish Godman*
S3M-5762 New Chapter for Vale of Leven Academy (lodged on 11 February 2010) Marilyn Livingstone*
